name: BEST WESTERN Rocky Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: I'm a Western US Regional Sales Representative for a rocktool manufacture thus, I stay at alot of hotels. And, I will say for the record, that this hotel is one of the better Best Western's I've stayed in.
reviews.title: Top Notch! Best beds in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A Place to Call Home in Whitefish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Glacier Gateway

likes.liked: — The OUTSTANDING staff who truly KNOW THE TERRITORY like the back of their hands!
likes.disliked: — Their significant rate increase over the past three years.

reviews.text: Did a large group ski trip a while ago with a bus load from Canada. The hotel was warm and inviting, typical of most ski lodges. Most importantly, they were able to efficiently accommodate such a big group of people. My room was clean and well prepared. Below are some good points to consider:
reviews.title: Good stay at Best Western
Use caution
reviews.text: 1) Short cab ride to restaurants in the main part of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in various motels 13 nights from the end of July to a few days ago. Four nights at BW Whitefish. It was by far our favorite place. We had a king suite, very nice, clean, comfortable bed, two large rooms, two windows and two great AC units, sink, fridge, microwave, etc. Also had a jacuzzi tub. Not sure if there is more than one building but if so we were in the main building. Seems I read reviews on here that the "annex" is not as nice, thus I specified main bldg when I reserved (thanks!).
reviews.title: Best Motel on our Vacation

likes.liked: — Comofortable bed, two windows, ac units, convenience

reviews.text: Lobby area very nice, staff very laid back and cordial (and helpful), grounds kept very well. Elevator was nice. Wireless internet worked great for both our laptops.
reviews.title: nice hotel
OK stay at the Rocky Mountain Lodge

likes.liked: — Nice hotel not too far from Galcier National Park.
likes.disliked: — No microwave or rfrigerator in room.

reviews.text: Glacier is a wonderful place to visit, the weather was great, Whitefish a nice mountain town. And this motel held up its end, we loved it.
reviews.title: Attractive hotel

reviews.text: We paid $172 per night plus taxes, booked about 6 weeks in advance.
reviews.title: Most comfortable bed and pillows ever in a hotel

reviews.text: I came to Whitefish on business and specifically chose this hotel because on its website it offers executive rooms with internet access. i hoped to have a business meeting in the Hotel with a prospective client. I was horrified. The so-called executive room was shabby, noisy, no hard wire for internet access despite the hotel guide stating find orange plug, could not access wireless,smelly ,with an extremely small desk in the middle of the room. I went down to the lobby to ask for another room to be told that there was no other room available and that they only had two hard wired rooms! My colleague had a room above the hotel laundry. The noise was indescribable without using hyperbole! I forgot about the dog hairs!!!!!! We did not stay.
reviews.title: Shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May husband and I spent 6 nights in a king mini-suite. The jetted tub was great after the long aiplane flight. It was nice to park the car in the evening and take advantage of the shuttle. The front desk clerks were very helpful regarding area restaurants and businesses. There was a computer in the lobby available for use by the guests. It even had a printer. If I ever make it to Whitefish again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Rocky Mountain lodge again. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Great hotel, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, basic, very large room, but noisy. Little or no sound insulation, so LOTS of road noise, also noise from room above, and hallway.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was easy to find and near centre of town..
reviews.title: Would stay again
Great hotel, definitely would come back....

aka: Best Western Rocky Mountain Hotel Whitefish
description: Choose this comfortable and convenient hotel in Whitefish near many of northern Montana's great outdoor attractions.For travelers looking for quality hotel lodging accommodations near Whitefish Mountain (formerly Big Mountain) Ski and Summer Resort, Glacier National Park, Flathead Lake, and Glacier International Airport, the BEST WESTERN Rocky Mountain Lodge offers the ideal lodging location and experience. Guests can enjoy mountain views and the hotel's pleasant and relaxing mountain lodge atmosphere. Located in beautiful Whitefish in Montana's Flathead Valley the BEST WESTERN Rocky Mountain Lodge also gives guests convenient access to outdoor sports and activities year-round, including: skiing, golfing, fishing, hiking, boating, whitewater rafting, kayaking, hunting and biking.The BEST WESTERN Rocky Mountain Lodge offers guestrooms with king or queen size beds. Suites, featuring a fire place, hot tub, and wet bar, are also available. This pet-friendly hotel has specially designated rooms available for guests who wish to travel with their dogs and/or cats. All rooms come fully equipped with cable satellite television and high speed Internet access. A deluxe, complimentary continental breakfast is served daily. Additional hotel amenities include an outdoor swimming pool, hot tub, fitness center, and a business center.Meeting rooms, banquet space, and conference services make this Montana retreat the perfect location for business activities and other small group events.
